column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)

column13: Westpac continuously gathers feedback from customers and employees to better understand how it can improve its service. Customer feedback through Net Promoter Score (NPS) and complaints channels is used to develop customer solutions. They measure the impact of enhancements and foster a customer-first culture across the Group.

Westpac's Market Disclosure Policy provides a framework for managing its disclosure obligations. It satisfies the disclosure requirements of the ASX, NZX, and other relevant offshore securities exchanges and relevant securities and corporations legislation. Under the policy, information that a reasonable person would expect to have a material effect on the price or value of Westpac's securities must first be disclosed via the ASX unless an exception applies under regulatory requirements.
column20: Market Disclosure Policy, disclosure obligation, securities exchange

column7: For employees not covered by collective bargaining agreements, their working conditions and terms of employment are stipulated in individual employment contracts, which adhere to relevant country employment standards and regulations.

Westpac begins its identification of material sustainability topics with the risks recorded in Westpac's integrated risk and compliance management system and prioritises sustainability-related risks with a higher 'Inherent Risk Rating'.
Westpac's material topics are financial performance, work culture, data privacy, and climate change.

column13: Westpac's Sustainability Strategy sets out how it works to serve its stakeholders better and addresses local and global challenges. The strategy was launched in 2020 and designed to operate for three years. The strategy had three pillars: helping when it matters the most, backing a stronger Australia and New Zealand, and collaborating for impact.

Westpac uses AI to improve its service, provide insights, and keep the bank and customers safe. For instance, AI drives Westpac's Everyday Banking chatbots, which provide 24/7 support to customers. The chatbots guide customers to a range of self-service features and can escalate the conversation to the right team member when required.

The Westpac Growth Labs research and development team explores how emerging technologies can deliver better services, make the bank safer and improve the lives of customers and employees. One research project investigated how generative AI can boost software development productivity. AI coding assistants offer suggestions that help developers save time. Following an experiment with 60 developers that found they were 46% more productive with AI assistance, Westapc launched AI coding assistants across its teams.
column14: It has led to a 20% increase in coding output for developers and is helping junior developers build capability faster.
column20: Westpac Growth Labs, research and development, AI

column13: Customers are increasingly using Westpac's website and app. Digital transactions increased by 11%, totalling almost 700 million over the year. The Westpac app is fast becoming customers' 'bank in the pocket', with over 5 million daily sessions. It offers customers instant access, payments, answers and approvals. Westpac also introduced new features over the year, including additional budgeting tools, carbon footprint tracking, ways to manage payment subscriptions and voice search functionality.
column20: Westpac App, digital transaction, instant access

column13: Westpac partnered with ShopBack to help Westpac customers get more for their money. More than five million credit and debit card customers can now access exclusive cashback offers via a dedicated ShopBack app and website hub. It will be available via the Westpac app next year.

This year, Westpac rolled out its single mortgage platform, which has made the approval process simpler and faster. On average, loan applications made directly by customers are approved in six days, while broker-originated applications take slightly longer. Westpac's ongoing focus on sharpening processes is helping to improve turnaround times.
column20: Single mortgage platform, approval process, loan application

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column7: Westpac generated $21,645 million in net income in 2023.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: Decarbonising the economy requires material investment. It is a significant opportunity, and Westpac focuses on further building its expertise and supporting more customers with sustainable finance. Westpac supported customers with 58 sustainable finance transactions in FY23. Westpac also provided $6.5 billion in new lending to climate change solutions since 2020, 86% more than the $3.5 billion target.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: The Group ESG Credit Risk Policy forms part of Westpac's credit risk assessment process. It requires completing an ESG-related risk assessment before approving finance and periodic reviews for certain customers and transactions. Westpac's Institutional bankers, supported by ESG specialists, complete these assessments. Transactions may also be escalated to a Customer and Transaction Risk Escalation Committee (CTREC) comprising business, sustainability, and risk management executives.
column20: ESG Credit Risk Policy, credit risk assessment, ESG specialist

column6: Defined benefit plan obligations and other retirement plans
column13: The Westpac Group Plan (WGP) is the Group's principal defined benefit plan and is managed and administered following the terms of its trust deed and relevant legislation in Australia. Its defined benefit liabilities are based on salary and length of membership for active members and inflation in the case of pensioners.
column20: Defined benefit plan, Westpac Group Plan, trust deed

column7: Westpac has yet to disclose this information.

Proportion of senior management hired from the local community
Proportion of spending on local suppliers
column7: Westpac spent $6.3 million on local suppliers in 2023.

column6: Operations assessed for risks related to corruption
column7: Westpac's Risk Management Strategy applies to all people within Westpac and its subsidiaries. Each of Westpac's operations is assessed for bribery and corruption risk as part of its enterprise risk management process.

column6: Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
column13: Westpac has no tolerance for any form of bribery or corruption. Westpac has an Anti-Bribery and Corruption (ABC) Policy, an ABC Standard, and bribery prevention procedures and systems. Material breaches of the ABC Policy are reported to the Board Risk Committee.
column20: Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy, bribery, corruption

column6: Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
column13: Westpac delivered a new Financial Crime Risk Awareness online training module, which was completed by 98% of all Group employees, aimed at continuing to build employee capability in identifying, mitigating and managing financial crime risk and exposures, financial crime red flags and Unusual Matters Reports (UMR). The training also demonstrated how to manage risk across several financial crime scenarios, which included modern slavery.
column20: Financial Crime Risk Awareness, Financial Crime Risk, Unusual Matters Report

column6: Confirmed incidents of corruption and actions taken
column7: There were no cases of corruption brought against Westpac in 2023.

column6: Legal actions for anti-competitive behavior, anti-trust, and monopoly practices
column8: Financial Crime Human Rights Integration Plan
column13: Westpac uses its Financial Crime Human Rights Integration Plan to identify and track initiatives to embed human rights (particularly modern slavery) considerations into existing financial crime risk frameworks and policies. The plan is supported by a monthly Financial Crime Human Rights working group, which is also used to share new typologies and case studies that may be used in the enhanced due diligence process.
column20: Financial Crime Human Rights Integration Plan, human rights, modern slavery, financial crime risk

column7: The Board approves Westpac's tax strategy and approach and aligns it with the Group's commercial, reputational, and business practices and its commitment to corporate responsibility.

column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column13: Westpac's tax governance includes the Tax Risk Management Framework and accompanying tax policies. The Board Audit Committee approves the framework and covers financial, regulatory and reputational risks. The framework uses a Three Lines of Defence approach to risk management, provides a mechanism for escalating material tax matters and ensures that material tax risk is reported to the Board Audit Committee.
column20: Tax Risk Management Framework, tax governance, risk management

column6: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
column7: Under the Australian Taxation Office's (ATO's) Justified Trust program, Westpac received high assurance over its income tax affairs. This high assurance rating means the ATO is confident that Westpac paid the right income tax for the 2017 and 2018 income years.
As appropriate, Westpac may consider enhancing the disclosures for this topic in the coming years. It includes any proposed legislative changes to Public country-by-country reporting that may apply.

Reclaimed products and thei packaging materials
